nodes.bodyText: @developerhb We no longer need the startLineNumber and endLineNumber fields in ImportDetails. Please replace their getters with ast.getLineNo() and ast.getLastChild().getLineNo().

Should I perform the following change?

Exactly.
@pbludov Do I need to re-generate diff report after this change?

@pbludov Do I need to re-generate diff report after this change?

Yes. You need to rebase on latest master and regenerate diff report.

@pbludov
Okay i will make the changes and create new diff report.

@pbludov
I think I should also remove the attributes startLineNumber and endLineNumber, because I am getting unread field exception in mvn clean verify. This would also lead to change in the constructor call. Should I go for this?

Should I go for this?

Yes, please.

@pbludov
Done
One minor: please move this note to getter Javadoc.
no, this time it is Javadoc only change, is it?

First sentence of Javadoc has the same sentence. It should be updated too.
Also should this be more like "start line from AST"? We are getting the start of the line so original documentation was not wrong, but we are retrieving it from the AST.
Done
Same.
Done
Note should somehow be separated from previous line. Javadoc generation by default will merge these 2 lines into one. I don't know what is the exact standard for writing notes.
Done

If I seperate it by a single line I am getting error that empty line should be followed by

tag. Link to the error https://ci.appveyor.com/project/Checkstyle/checkstyle/builds/32866348/job/yujeehocq1sxi5hd#L224

Previously also, there was no separation between line and note.
Please have a look
https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/master/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/imports/CustomImportOrderCheck.java#L989

@rnveach I have separated the note using

tag
Done
